page.title: 14St.Matthew's Church Wookey
page.content: The original church on this site, which belonged to the bishops of Bath and Wells, is believed to have been built between 1136 and 1166. Tradition has it that the church commemorates the spot where the fallen were buried after a battle between Saxons and Danes. An interesting feature of the chancel arch pillars is the two long squints put there so that the priests at secondary altars could see the stage the service has reached at the main altar About 1555 the support wall of the south aisle was removed and the south east chapel was built, probably as a mortuary chapel was Thomas Clarke, brother of the Bishop of Bath and Wells, who died at the Manor House, and whose tomb stands between this chapel and the Sanctuary.
